sentences.english: The first thing to do is book a venue.
sentences.chinese: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。

sentences.english: The band will play (= perform at ) as many venues as possible.
sentences.chinese: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

detailed_translations.english: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place

sentences.english: the Museum of Modern Art
sentences.chinese: 现代艺术博物馆

sentences.english: The museum has an extensive collection of early photographs.
sentences.chinese: 这座博物馆藏有大量早期的照片。

detailed_translations.english: a building where important  cultural, historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public

sentences.english: Edinburgh Castle
sentences.chinese: 爱丁堡城堡

sentences.english: a ruined castle
sentences.chinese: 破败的城堡

detailed_translations.english: a very large strong building, built in the past as a safe place that could be easily defended against attack

detailed_translations.chinese: 置…于城堡中；筑城堡防御

sentences.english: The building is unsafe.
sentences.chinese: 那栋大楼不安全。

sentences.english: water that’s unsafe to drink
sentences.chinese: 不能安全饮用的水

detailed_translations.chinese: 不安全的；危险的；不安稳的
detailed_translations.english: dangerous or likely to cause harm

sentences.english: companies that are polluting and destroying the environment
sentences.chinese: 污染和破坏环境的公司

detailed_translations.english: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists or cannot be used or repaired

sentences.english: The bomb went off at 9.30 in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹在早上9点半爆炸。

sentences.english: Enemy planes dropped over 200 bombs during the raid.
sentences.chinese: 袭击中敌机投下了两百多枚炸弹。

sentences.english: He was killed in a bomb explosion.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次炸弹爆炸中身亡。

sentences.english: The town was heavily bombed in World War II.
sentences.chinese: 这座城镇在第二次世界大战中遭到猛烈轰炸。

detailed_translations.english: a weapon made of material that will explode
to attack a place by leaving a bomb there, or by dropping bombs on it from a plane

sentences.english: The project required the total demolition of the old bridge.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程要求那座旧桥的彻底拆除。

detailed_translations.english: The demolition of a structure, for example, a building, is the act of deliberately destroying it, often in order to build something else in its place

sentences.english: Police were reconstructing the movements of the murdered couple.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在重现这对被害夫妇的行为活动。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a complete description or copy of an event by collecting together pieces of information

sentences.english: The church was completely rebuilt in the last century.
sentences.chinese: 这座教堂在上个世纪全面重建。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重建；改造，重新组装；复原
detailed_translations.english: to build something again, after it has been damaged or destroyed

sentences.english: We have spent money on refurbishing the offices.
sentences.chinese: 我们已在这些办公室的翻新上花了钱。

detailed_translations.english: To refurbish a building or room means to clean it and decorate it and make it more attractive or better equipped

sentences.english: If the company was to relocate, most employees would move.
sentences.chinese: 如果公司要迁移，大多数员工得搬家。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or business relocates, or if they are relocated, they move to a different place

sentences.english: The exterior walls need a new coat of paint.
sentences.chinese: 外墙需要刷新漆了。

detailed_translations.english: on the outside of something
the outside of something, especially a building

sentences.english: They hired a small company to repaint the dining room.
sentences.chinese: 他们雇用一个小公司重新油漆饭厅。

detailed_translations.english: to apply a new or fresh coat of paint

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

sentences.english: The interior walls are all painted white.
sentences.chinese: 室内墙壁都粉刷成了白色。

sentences.english: The interior of the church was dark.
sentences.chinese: 教堂里很暗。

detailed_translations.english: inside or indoors
the inner part or inside of something

sentences.english: rooms with high ceilings
sentences.chinese: 天花板很高的房间

sentences.english: a light hanging from the ceiling
sentences.chinese: 吊在天花板上的灯

detailed_translations.english: the inner surface of the top part of a room

sentences.english: You can carry this bag – it’s fairly light.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拿这个袋子——它很轻。

sentences.english: You should wear light, comfortable shoes.
sentences.chinese: 你应该穿轻便舒适的鞋子。

sentences.english: The truck was quite light and easy to drive.
sentences.chinese: 这辆卡车很轻，容易驾驶。

sentences.english: people who have suffered only light exposure to radiation
sentences.chinese: 只受到轻度辐射的人

detailed_translations.english: not very heavy

sentences.english: A crystal chandelier lit the room.
sentences.chinese: 一盏水晶吊灯照亮了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a large round frame for holding  candle s  or lights that hangs from the ceiling and is decorated with small pieces of glass

sentences.english: the Great Wall of China
sentences.chinese: 中国的长城

sentences.english: We climbed over the wall into the orchard.
sentences.chinese: 我们翻墙进了果园。

detailed_translations.english: an upright flat structure made of stone or brick, that divides one area from another or surrounds an area

sentences.english: In our case, we have found the true acoustic echo beacon.
sentences.chinese: 但在这种情况下，我们发现了真正的声学‘回声灯塔’ ”。

sentences.english: This gives it excellent thermal and acoustic properties, but the suitability of the product for a large-scale commercial project was questioned.
sentences.chinese: 这给了它出色的热学和声学属性，但是这种产品是否适合于一个大尺度的商业项目还是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有关声音的, 声学的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound and the way people hear things

sentences.english: a polished wooden floor
sentences.chinese: 上过蜡的木地板

sentences.english: a puddle of water on the kitchen floor
sentences.chinese: 厨房地面上的一摊水

sentences.english: a warehouse that has 410,000 square feet of floor space
sentences.chinese: 楼面面积为41万平方英尺的仓库

detailed_translations.chinese: 地板，地面；楼层；基底；议员席
detailed_translations.english: the flat surface that you stand on inside a building

detailed_translations.chinese: 铺地板；打倒，击倒；（被困难）难倒
detailed_translations.english: to hit someone so hard that they fall down

sentences.english: They bought an old schoolhouse to live in and built a workshop in the basement.
sentences.chinese: 他们买了座旧校舍居住，还在地下室建了个作坊。

detailed_translations.english: a room or area in a building that is under the level of the ground

sentences.english: I went and waited in the foyer.
sentences.chinese: 我去了，在门厅里等着。

detailed_translations.english: a room or hall at the entrance to a public building

sentences.english: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。

sentences.english: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。

sentences.english: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
sentences.chinese: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

sentences.english: They took the lift down to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。

sentences.english: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
sentences.chinese: 在三楼，我们乘电梯上去吧。

detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone upwards into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

sentences.english: We’ll have to take the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 我们只好坐电梯了。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that takes people and goods from one level to another in a building

sentences.english: Take the escalator to the third floor and it's the last office on the left.
sentences.chinese: 乘电梯到4楼，左边最后的那个办公室就是。

detailed_translations.english: a set of moving stairs that take people to different levels in a building

sentences.english: Let's get our coats at the cloakroom and not come back.
sentences.chinese: 我们去衣帽间取大衣，然后就别回来了。

sentences.english: ...a cloakroom attendant.
sentences.chinese: …一名衣帽间服务员。

detailed_translations.english: The cloakroom at a public building such as a theatre or club is the place where customers can leave their coats, usually for a small fee

sentences.english: We’re getting to the stage where we hardly ever go out together.
sentences.chinese: 我们快要到几乎不一起外出的地步了。

sentences.english: She is on stage for most of the play.
sentences.chinese: 这出戏的大部分时间里她都在台上

detailed_translations.english: a particular time or state that something reaches as it grows or develops

sentences.english: He went backstage and asked for her autograph.
sentences.chinese: 他到后台去请她签名。

detailed_translations.english: In a theatre, backstage refers to the areas behind the stage

sentences.english: Anderson was to sing at the Constitution Hall auditorium.
sentences.chinese: 安德森将要在宪法厅的观众席演唱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a theatre where people sit when watching a play, concert etc

sentences.english: They hope for government funding for the programme.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望得到政府为这一计划提供的资金。

detailed_translations.chinese: 基金， 资金； 提供资金
detailed_translations.english: Funding is money which a government or organization provides for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The Government are planning further cuts in public spending.
sentences.chinese: 政府正计划进一步削减公共支出。

sentences.english: The US government has tightened restrictions on firearms.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府已经加强了对枪支的管制。

sentences.english: Neither party had the majority necessary to form a government.
sentences.chinese: 两个政党都没有获得组阁所必需的多数票。

sentences.english: strong government
sentences.chinese: 强有力的统治

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who govern a country or state

sentences.english: the council for civil liberties
sentences.chinese: 公民自由委员会

sentences.english: the UN Security Council
sentences.chinese: 联合国安全理事会

detailed_translations.english: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered
